article:
A 'profile' in the Unified Modeling Language (UML) provides a generic extension
mechanism for customizing UML models for particular domains and platforms.
Extension mechanisms allow refining standard semantics in strictly additive
manner, so that they can't contradict standard semantics. Si Alhir, S: Guide
to applying the UML, page 350. Springer, 2002

Profiles are defined using stereotypes, tag definitions, and constraints that
are applied to specific model elements, such as Classes, Attributes, Operations,
and Activities. A Profile is a collection of such extensions that collectively
customize UML for a particular domain (e.g., aerospace, healthcare, financial)
or platform (J2EE, .NET).
